doc.after: George IV came to the throne in 1820 intending to create a set of royal palaces that reflected his wealth and influence as the ruler of an increasingly powerful Britain.[179] George's previous houses, Carlton House and the Brighton Pavilion were too small for grand court events, even after expensive extensions.[179] George expanded the Royal Lodge in the castle park whilst he was Prince Regent, and then began a programme of work to modernise the castle itself once he became king.[179]
